name: Antibiotic stewardship: co-amoxiclav, cephalosporins & quinolones (KTT9)
title: Antibiotic stewardship: co-amoxiclav, cephalosporins & quinolones (KTT9):
Number of prescription items for co-amoxiclav, cephalosporins and quinolones as a percentage of the
total number of prescription items for selectedvantibacterial drugs (sub-set of BNF 5.1)
description: Number of prescription items for co-amoxiclav, cephalosporins and quinolones as a percentage
of total prescription items for cephalosporins, macrolides, metronidazole tinidazole & ornidazole,
penicillins, quinolones, sulphonamides & trimethoprim, tetracyclines and drugs for urinary-tract infections.
why_it_matters: Co-amoxiclav, cephalosporins and quinolones are broad spectrum antibiotics that can be used when others have failed.
It is important that they are used sparingly, to avoid drug-resistant bacteria developing.
This measure looks at the quantity of these prescribed, versus the broad class of similar antibiotics.
numerator_where: (bnf_code LIKE '0501013K0%'  OR bnf_code LIKE '0501021%'  OR bnf_code LIKE '050112%')
denominator_where: bnf_code LIKE '0501021%' OR bnf_code LIKE '050105%' OR bnf_code LIKE '050111%' OR bnf_code LIKE '050101%'
OR bnf_code LIKE '050112%' OR bnf_code LIKE '050108%' OR bnf_code LIKE '050103%' OR bnf_code LIKE '050113%')
